Key Match Events: Uruguay and Canada drew 2-2 after 90 minutes of play in the third-place playoff.
Luis Suarez scored a last-minute goal to send the match into a penalty shootout.
Canada's Alphonso Davies and Jonathan David scored penalties in the shootout.
Uruguay won the penalty shootout 4-3 to secure third place.
Alphonso Davies had a standout performance with a key goal and penalty save.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada coach Jesse Marsch praised the team's performance and potential, highlighting their impressive debut at the Copa America.
Uruguay coach Marcelo Bielsa acknowledged the team's performance and the challenge of motivating the players after a semi-final loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Canada's appearance in the Copa America was their first, marking a significant milestone in their soccer journey.
